NAEB HEADQUARTERS
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
AIR MAIL
October 7, 1957
Mr. E. E. Maes
Deputy Executive Director
Fundacion Creole
Apartado 889
Caracas, Venezuela
Dear Mr. Maes:
lour letter is one of several which raise the question of consultation
assistance and other relations we might provide for groups outside the.
U. S. Since we do not have a procedure set up for this yet, I would like
very much to hold it for discussion at Board meetings at the end of this
month. Would this delay inconvenience you too much?
I am quite surej however, that we shall be able and willing to provide
you a list of consultants you need in general planning, programming, and.
technical areas in some manner or another, subject of course to the working
out of satisfactory arrangements. We already provide such consultation
services within the U. S., so there will be no difficulty in providing the
best qualified experts in virtually any area you need.
It would be helpful, however, if you could specify more exactly in what
areas consultants would be needed, so the action taken by our Board to
regularize such services may be as intelligent and broad as possible.
Sincerely,
HJS/dfc
Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director
